page.title: 05WORCESTERSHIRE HOUSING
page.content:
The largest building in this area is Eastington Hall, a private house of timber-framed construction built about 1500. It is sometimes available for Rugby Club, Rotary Club and similar functions. The owners are proud of their property, and pleased to show it off to visitors.
In common with many other rural areas, small properties are often purchased for holiday and weekend use by people who live in towns. To the south of Stanks Lane, in the corner of a field, is one such cottage, the garden of which is well maintained.
